summary: This document is an email chain from July 12, 2019, between FBI personnel and an external contact. The external contact is relaying information from an investigative journalist friend about a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein who claims to have information on the abuse process and high-level government figures, including a former president. The FBI instructs the contact to have the victim call the national tip line or provide contact information for follow-up.

persons.name: Linda Collins Smith
persons.context: Mentioned by the external email writer as a brief contact who had information on child trafficking and was later murdered; the writer believes the FBI is investigating her murder.

events.title: Email Referral of Potential Epstein Victim
events.description: An external contact emails FBI personnel to refer a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein, who claims to have information on the abuse process and high-level government individuals.

events.title: Murder of Linda Collins Smith
events.description: The murder of Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith is referenced; she was reportedly in contact with the email writer about a CPS corruption case and had information on child trafficking.

keyFacts: A potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein is identified, described as credible and possessing information about the abuse process and 'high level government people; one former president.'
The information comes via an investigative journalist friend of the email writer, who was previously working with a now-deceased female retired cop on human trafficking.
The FBI's New York office, specifically Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking), is engaged and provides instructions for the victim to contact the 1-800-CALL-FBI tip line.
The email writer also references brief contact with the late Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith, who was murdered and reportedly had information on child trafficking.
The document shows an active channel of information from external sources to the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
